snippet: Lawyers and bankers are suggesting that Greece offer a buyback of its debt, and possibly invoke clauses in its bond contracts to put pressure on debt holders to accept the offer.
abstract: Lawyers and bankers are suggesting that Greece offer a buyback of its debt, and possibly invoke clauses in its bond contracts to put pressure on debt holders to accept it; aim is to further reduce ever-increasing sovereign debt burden that is fast approaching 200 percent of gross domestic product.
lead_paragraph: Lawyers and bankers are suggesting that Greece offer a buyback of its debt, and possibly invoke clauses in its bond contracts to put pressure on debt holders to accept the offer.

headline.seo: Greece Looks at Offering Creditors a Buyback to Lower Its Debt
headline.main: Greece Examines a Debt Buyback as One Way to Reduce Its Burden
